subs.text:
Responsibility
to renewable systems

would be a satisfying
and enduring cultural story

much better than our current one,

which glorifies the frantic 
and ecstatic strip-mining
of the planet’s resources,

crashing the natural systems
that make the resources
in the first place.
subs.rawText:
Responsibility
to renewable systems

would be a satisfying
and enduring cultural story

much better than our current one,

which glorifies the frantic

of the planet’s resources,

crashing the natural systems
that make the resources
in the first place.

subs.text:
First day of spring semester, 1977, walking on a campus sidewalk. Ahead on the cement, I see a piece of paper money. Picked it up, looked around, said, “It’s a $100 bill.”

The young woman walking behind me said, “I should have gotten out of bed five minutes earlier today.”
subs.rawText:
First day of spring semester, 1977, walking on a campus sidewalk. Ahead on the cement, I see a piece of paper money. Picked it up, looked around, said, “It’s a $100 bill.”

The young woman walking behind me said, “I should have gotten out of bed five minutes earlier today.”

subs.text: If memory serves me, part of what brought the Cuban missile crisis to an end was the U.S. agreeing to remove some missiles from near the Soviet Union, in Turkey.

subs.text: 1/3 The Stones are on the box, loud enough so I notice the drums. Next song, again it's the drums. I usually think the Stones are about the sting of the guitars and the backbone and sneer and syrup of the voice and the words, but no, tonight the drummer is the front man.
subs.rawText: 1/3 The Stones are on the box, loud enough so I notice the drums. Next song, again it's the drums. I usually think the Stones are about the sting of the guitars and the backbone and sneer and syrup of the voice and the words, but no, tonight the drummer is the front man.

subs.text: 2/3 Music teaches young people how to feel something, I think my sister said. Maybe that's the wound steel of the strings stretched and plucked, doing their part, but tonight the drums seem to say: don't just feel something, you'd better move.
subs.rawText: 2/3 Music teaches young people how to feel something, I think my sister said. Maybe that's the wound steel of the strings stretched and plucked, doing their part, but tonight the drums seem to say: don't just feel something, you'd better move.

subs.text: 3/3 The backbone, the attitude, well, we need that whenever we move out into the streets. The words might help us know why that is. Help us set sweet against bitter as we go.
subs.rawText: 3/3 The backbone, the attitude, well, we need that whenever we move out into the streets. The words might help us know why that is. Help us set sweet against bitter as we go.

subs.text: And then one of the cruel songs comes on.
subs.rawText: And then one of the cruel songs comes on.

subs.text: Inside Wire: Colorado Prison Radio "beams music, stories, information, and entertainment into prisons across Colorado ... and beyond. Our programs are created by incarcerated media producers for incarcerated listeners." [link]

subs.text: @cameronponsonby @blzzrd I grew up in a family of goalkeepers and goalie coaches in St. Louis, Missouri, one of the U.S.’s few real old football towns. Everyone I show this article to texts me saying, “Yes!” My brother’s son said, “Dad, you used to shout those same things at the TV when I was a kid.”

subs.text: When a person or a country decides to make war, no only do they destroy visible and tangible things, but they also steal hours of everyday life for years to come. Putin is a thief, one among many. [link]
